greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of different lengths that perfect rulers with n segments can have.
comment: For definitions, references and links related to complete rulers see A103294.
link: F. Schwartau, Y. Schröder, L. Wolf and J. Schoebel, MRLA search results and source code, Nov 6 2020.

F. Schwartau, Y. Schröder, L. Wolf and J. Schoebel, Large Minimum Redundancy Linear Arrays: Systematic Search of Perfect and Optimal Rulers Exploiting Parallel Processing, IEEE Open Journal of Antennas and Propagation, 2 (2021), 79-85.
Index entries for sequences related to perfect rulers.
example: a(5)=4 because a perfect ruler with 5 segments may have the length 10, 11, 12 or 13.
results.author: _Peter Luschny_, Feb 28 2005
ext: Term a(19) corrected and terms a(20)-a(25) added by Fabian Schwartau, _Yannic Schröder_, Lars Wolf, Joerg Schoebel, Feb 23 2021
